bow: favorite non newborn related part of being in the hospital post birth may be tmi on my part was just reminiscing with my sister about when my stinkerbell was born and went on tangent about random things like that never saw my placenta was so relieved did poop it weird that the scissors to cut the cord were these fancy golden scissors and how gross it was when the nurse took me to the bathroom to squeeze gunk out of my uterus then suddenly remembered the most pleasant thing and probably my very favorite part aside from my new baby of course about my time in the hospital and it was those freaking cold pads was so upset when they started giving me the warming ones the cold ones felt so good what was your favorite non baby and non family related part of being in the hospital after giving birth not completely on topic but my favorite part of post baby hospital stay was how fracking awesome felt had rather miserable pregnancy was exhausted nauseous and uncomfortable from about weeks to the end of my pregnancy to the point was loosing weight amp being lectured by the doctors my daughter was born at 35 weeks completely healthy and within an hour of her birth felt great took shower put on my own pajamas amp begged the nurses to let me take walk around the hospital with my baby they tried to dose me with pain meds every 15 minutes for the first few hours until they realized was fine amp was going to take anything before her birth was really thinking she was going to be an only child but now pretty sure could do it all again the breakfast menu lunch and dinner were fairly crap but the breakfast menu had rolls sliced meat cheese eggs juices fruit yoghurt mmmmmmmm nom did have my kids in hospital birthing center but my favorite thing was also the cold pads they were amazing took bunch home with me plus the midwives sent me home with some tea tree oil and perineum oil taking warm sitz bath with the tea tree and peri oils at home was like magic pill to relax oh and the natural high that had for about week afterwards amazing the nurses were amazing there was one nurse in particular who was very sweet and offered awesome advice including ignore advice that does feel right to me she was wonderful the coolest part was just being alone to look at my beautiful baby without needing to share was still really really glad to go home and shower and be in my own space the dial for dining program at our hospital just pick up the phone place an order and it gets delivered to your room and it was good food too so nice to relax with your baby and not have to worry about cooking or washing dishes ps the cold pads at our hospital are just heavy menstrual pads soaked in water rolled up and frozen you can make your own us nurses wrap them in dryer sheets to prevent them from sticking to your tender perineum post delivery had really good post birth experience labor was rough induced 12 hours in have to go in for an emergency section my body would properly numb so they had to knock me out so missed the entire birth but got to stay at the hospital for about three days afterwards was one of two patients in the whole unit so got some awesome care most of my nurses were so nice and let my so sleep in the other bed in my room due to low census so we got to hang out with our new little family in big private room with actually not bad food it was teaching hospital and most people were so freaked out that chose that one but believe had much better experience than my friends that gave birth at busier hospital work at the biggest hospital in the tri state area and did not want to have that experience the thing that surprised me the most was how much enjoyed having catheter in was soooo tired after my 24+ hour natural labor birth but could sleep at least could just lay there and chug water without getting up every 20 minutes pouted when they took it out and had to actually walk to the bathroom is it bad that loved the squeezy things on my legs had high blood pressure during pregnancy and after my section there were these cuffs for my legs to help with my circulation it was like getting leg massage all the time my first delivery is blur lots of drugs to help handle contractions while they waited for something to happen ended up having section so when we found out we were having thought about my experience after delivering knowing was going to have another section was weird to me but after oh the menu told my husband ca wait to have chicken stir fry and homemade hummus for lunch dinner and the giant fruit plate for breakfast mmmmm deleted the mesh underwear love it going to stock up next time wow reading all these stories made me realize had terrible post birth experience was just happy to go home my first pregnancy had an extreme case of hyperemesis gravadarum and starved the whole pregnancy my ob kept promising me that the nausea would go away as soon as gave birth it was the only thing that kept me going knowing there was an end date my daughter was born in the middle of the night when woke up for breakfast after brief nap there was steaming bowl of plain oatmeal an applesauce cup and tea waiting for me during my pregnancy could handle any of those honestly the oatmeal had the consistency of cardboard paste does matter best meal of my life had no nausea it remains my fondest memory of childbirth finally being able to fill my stomach in comfort without paying homage to the porcelain gods afterwards ahh my favorite part makes me want to have another baby all over again *being waited on hand and foot and having the hospital masseuse come in and fix my back* was **incredible** have always been people pleaser so find myself doing everything for everyone always for three solid days someone took care of *me* too had hyperemesis and feel your pain sister that first meal is like gobbling up gold and rainbows aww what happened the shower the next morning omg it was beautiful had felt so dirty and that big warm shower made me feel soooo clean this was mine too for those glorious ten minutes until passed out because forgot to ventilate the bathroom bought me an extra day of tasty breakfast though the epidural baha mine felt like dream was high as kite for hours we still talk about all the crazy things said while was under the influence also the med students it was the first week of med school rounds and they were just so eager the one guy acted like emptying my catheter was the funnest thing *ever* they were all in awe when he came out and all three even shed tear too they also stopped by to visit the next day it was fun deleted deleted cold pads were awesome also my hospital gives you mani pedi in your bed afterwards that was super cool eek the cold pads at my hospital were actually ice packs that you squeeze to pop then shake and they get cold pretty much the same for me daughter born at 35w5d but had an epidural so could walk for few hours felt really great though the pregnancy made my back and hips hurt so badly that once no longer had that pressure it was world of difference ca tell you the number of times called and got grilled cheese with bacon on it was in the hospital for week nesting though due to my daughter being born just over weeks early my epidural was lovely too it made me so zen and got to rest little bit before the big push it was awesome well my son was born week after we moved halfway across the country he was also born right after huge storm that knocked out power in four states we were in this little rural hospital that had never been to before and they had just gotten power back the day before they only had two birthing rooms and there were five women in labor that night was set up in spare room where they kept all the old and broken equipment was only 1cm dilated when my water broke so the had to manually dilate me with foley catheter and no pain meds the nurses were very helpful but that night there were only three nurses for five women my son was born at 6am was then moved to more permanent room but it was still not the normal room they use all the furniture was broken in some way since we had just moved only had three visitors my husband my mother who caught the red eye and friend who also moved with us he and my husband are currently going to the same med school the food was terrible and came in small portions had to send my husband out to get me food but there was hardly any food in the city because we just moved and the power outage meant that stores were out of food ended up eating plain bagels had hard time feeding my son and when the lactation consultant came by 38 hours after my son was born she only spent about ten minutes with me she basically came in grabbed my breast saw that my son latched and left had so many questions and no answers finally went home after two days to an apartment filled with boxes and my mom sleeping in the living room because there was no where else to sleep my mom stayed for five days before flying back home and my husband started med school two weeks later had no clue what was going on was so confused alone and stressed out do know how made it but things are so much better now my son is happy and healthy ve made friends and ve lost ten pounds so far and that is my story of how spent last summer so close to having baby again so have been thinking of all the things like about the hospital stay afterwards my favorite the meal after birth always order two meals cause am ravenous and can actually eat oh just love it the rice krispies was gestational diabetic during both of my pregnancies so that giant bowl of carbs fake sugar was like heaven was fortunate enough to be right across the hall from the snack room had both my kids in the same room oddly enough so would sneak over there every time got up amp grab bowl or two sidenote are you sure you did poop when we were in childbirth class our instructor was talking about how that was huge deal for so many people of all the weird scary things that were happening or about to happen to their body the thing that women were most afraid of was if someone would see them poop she said that anytime anyone ever asked if they had pooped they would always just say nope not even little because that what they wanted needed to hear always thought that was sweet ugh loved being at teaching hospital was so thrilled to be able to give resident the opportunity to witness vaginal twin birth he was very excited and grateful besides there were already like 10 people in the room so what was one more omg you poor thing so sorry you had to go through that you are very strong and should be so proud of yourself really thanks things are so much better now ha our breakfast menu was available at all times plus my insurance paid for unlimited food so could order whatever whenever it was pretty damn good too what the heck are cold pads do think got any of those but the way you guys talk about them makes me feel like missed out sleeping alone this is exactly what was just thinking loved having the nurses around for both of my kids with my second child ended up being the last woman in the maternity ward for days so all the nurses were hanging out with me loved that when my husband went to go home and take shower and nap that the nurses came in and changed my sons diapers for me so could take long hour nap this was something they were not expected to do but was so grateful for it also had strange craving after my son for oranges oatmeal and bananas called down to the kitchen almost every hours for more the lady who answered the phone started to remember me it was sad my husband had procured corner room for me far away from other moms and babies my daughter was in nicu so while she was healing so was felt incredibly guilty that was bonding with her 24 but it was something to be alone with my thoughts and new reality after giving birth for first time watching tv and eating food relatives brought me however do remember her actual birth at all the nurses were highlight reassuring me that would break my baby and giving advice person always remembers awesome nurses this was sick my entire pregnancy the morning after giving birth got up and brushed my teeth without throwing up or even gagging it was the best feeling in the world had pretty easy pregnancy and easy short labor but after he was born omg ve never felt so good the adrenaline rush was unreal and was just over the moon also having breakfast delivered to my room the next morning with giant cup of coffee had given up coffee during pregnancy this time around am super excited about getting to stay overnight at the hospital just me and the baby since hubby and my son will have to go home for the evening lol masseuses mani pedis and delicious food holy crap gave birth in the wrong hospital heh pretty much had to beg for ice packs from the unhelpful nurses the rooms were closet sized and the food was standard bland hospital fare the best part was getting the hell out of there though they did have lactation consultant who swear was the sweetest woman on the planet she was really encouraging and wanted to adopt her as kindly aunt or something liked pretty much all the food got in the hospital it seriously some of the best tasting good for you food ve had honestly at the time was completely overwhelmed and glad the nurses could take my son for an hour or two to get some rest he had fair amount of amniotic fluid in his lungs even though delivered vaginally and turned blue and stopped breathing and just froze luckily nurse was there to grab him and get the fluids out my hospital had amazing cheesecake had it with every meal was also really into not having morning sickness anymore threw up every day until delivered remember having contractions and throwing up in the bathroom and telling the nurse pro when she asked if was okay losing the catheter was one of the worst things for me too this nurse kept coming in and hassling me to go pee pee even though still could feel my bladder so had no idea when it was full or how to relax it to go also that first shower after giving birth for me was covered in blood and gunk my fingernails were caked with it looked like zombie being clean again was an amazing feeling plus the shower had stool so could sit down agree the best part about the hospital was leaving edit also the nurses there some kickass nurses little slice of pure bliss that floated down from heaven to land in my crotch seriously though they were the awesome pads soaked in water or some other fluid witch hazel and frozen and then placed into your mesh granny panties to provide your swollen raw undercarriage instant relief me too had preclampsia sp with twins so after 12 hours of trying to do natural birth had to have an emergency section they would let me eat anything before the surgery started eating the little ice chips they have thought they were the best thing ever my body had to re learn how to eat solids pass gas poo and pee it sucked but man those ice chips were yummy was induced and was in labor for 10 hrs which meant no water or food only ice chips after my son was born hrs of pushing literally drank close to gallon of water and had two servings of chicken tenders and fries it was so so sooooo good was just happy to have food served to me that did cook did care how it tasted never got anything like that making mental note to request those when have my next child my post partum nurses gave me frozen surgical gloves got in all the right places good god they were amazing my husband kept laughing at the major bulge in my pants have to agree it was amazing gt hospital masseuse sorry the hospital what why have not heard of this went to women amp infants they are the top birthing hospital in the united states which just happens to be in my state they not only fixed my back but taught me and my husband how to do destimulationg infant massage it has helped tremendously when our baby was colicky they also have water births standing births and just about anything woman in labor could want it comes with 50 000 bill but they also take state insurance with referral it was the best experience and so calm and bonding with our baby wish had gone there with my second child but am not longer on state insurance and my private insurance company laughed when asked for prior authorization to go there lol edit was so lucky to go there and wish could give you all the chance to go there and give you all the best possible births there are love you mommit hope this post does sound braggy got ta be honest here it was the drugs the sweet sweet drugs lol love how you put that yes that exactly what it tasted like had my baby at home but think my favorite post birth non baby thing was steak my husband would let me eat my steak cooked less than medium well so right after the birth my doula picked up some steaks and cooked them nice and rare for me oh the catheters sucked so badly for me full term births with them each time after had my youngest section my other two were not was begging the nurse to take it out as soon as was out of recovery but was allowed to until or hours had passed because my bladder would work properly until then and with could not pee after having him and they had to re cath me ugh as soon as the epidural spinals wore off it just felt like had to pee so bad but got no relief with the catheter in loved how great felt was so miserable at the end had my first at 34 weeks so had experienced the last month and with my second she came right at 40 weeks and was so big and miserable once had her felt amazing and loved having someone wait on me and bring me food even if it was crappy also love those things was that the storm that hit june 29 that storm was bitch our surrounding areas were out of power for days yep that the one we were actually driving in the storm as it was hitting ohio we re like are those tornados maybe we should pull over our apt complex was lucky because it was on the same grid as the walmart and the hospital however the people just up the hill had to wait five more days certainly take electricity for granted cried over eating fast food because we could cook at our house totally cracked without electricity when started seeing parts of our little town getting restored have never been so happy had the nurse give me two packs to take home with me so comfortable still being alive oh my gosh the cold pads were heavenly the food was pretty good too and ate like never seen food before know they thought was ordering for myself and my husband but ate every bite of it myself up vote for stinkerbell call my daughter that also where my sister just delivered weeks ago they fill newborn diapers with ice for that purpose had these when was in the hospital during my miscarriage and when left asked if could take them home with me had forgotten about them until just now and now want them back again all of my hospital food was awful do think had these they sound awesome though those are the ones talking about they got so cold but put washcloth on top of it and it was just perfect omg same thing for me love rare steak and doc said only medium well during pregnancy also coke awesome started calling her that and did even make the connection to tinkerbell until my friend her godmom heard me call her that and she was like omg that so clever and funny and was like what do you oh yeah haha can be clever sometimes coke really think would have murdered someone if they said could have my sodas remember when went out to lunch with my dad and husband to chinese buffet they had these little octopus in some sort of sauce and came back to the table with five on my plate they looked at me with disgust and said you know you ca eat that because of the baby right was just like fuck off
